    Introduction to Rseries

Introduction to Rseries

diognes

28/04/2022

Source: vignettes/simple_examples.Rmd
simple_examples.Rmd

Brief explanation

We can select two palettes at the moment: palette_netflyx and palette_anime. Each palette is a list of series. Each palette in this package have a total of 6 colors. With the function serie_palette we can select a palette following this entry:

serie_palette( enter name, palette of preference, number of colors, type discrete or continous )

Each palette estructure looks similar to this:

# serie netflyx palettes color

palette_netflyx <- list(
  Lupin        = c("#E26A40","#0E263C","#3B6183","#5C85B1","#7BA0C6","#D9E2EC"),
  
  Ozark         =c("#a9d2d0","#62a7af","#4d8a9d","#2b6b76","#1c5758","#123b4c"),
  
  GambitoDama   =c("#291f2a","#634039","#916b58","#be754c","#9a4d1b","#824529"),
  
  EstamosMuert = c("#c9cacc","#96aea8","#465e69","#5d5e4d","#1c4b46","#8f4031")
)

Let’s see some examples using ggplot2 based on the R Graph Gallery examples.

Palette: Lupin

A classic boxplot 

# Libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(Rseries)

# create a dataset
data <- data.frame(
  name=c( rep("A",500), rep("B",500), rep("B",500), rep("C",20), rep('D', 100)),
  value=c( rnorm(500, 10, 5), rnorm(500, 13, 1), rnorm(500, 18, 1), rnorm(20, 25, 4), rnorm(100, 12, 1) )
)

# Plot
pal=serie_palette("Lupin", palette_netflyx, 5)

data %>%
  ggplot( aes(x=name, y=value, fill=name)) +
    geom_boxplot() +
    scale_fill_manual(values=(pal)) +
    theme_classic() +
    theme(
      legend.position="none",
      plot.title = element_text(size=11)
    ) +
    ggtitle("A classic boxplot") +
    xlab("")

Some density charts 

# Libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(Rseries)

pal=serie_palette("Lupin", palette_netflyx, 5)

# Using the diamods dataset we can some of the palettes in our package.

# Multi density chart
p1 <- ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=price,fill=cut))+
  geom_density(position='stack')+
  scale_fill_manual(values=(pal))+
  theme_minimal()
p1

# Stacked density plot
p2 <- ggplot(data=diamonds, aes(x=price, group=cut, fill=cut)) +
    geom_density(adjust=1.5, position="fill") +
    scale_fill_manual(values=(pal)) +
    theme_minimal()
p2

Some data art 

# Libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(RColorBrewer)

# create a dataset
set.seed(345)
ngroup=30
names=paste("G_",seq(1,ngroup),sep="")
DAT=data.frame()

for(i in seq(1:30)){
  data=data.frame( matrix(0, ngroup , 3))
  data[,1]=i
  data[,2]=sample(names, nrow(data))
  data[,3]=prop.table(sample( c(rep(0,113),c(1:ngroup)) ,nrow(data)))
  DAT=rbind(DAT,data)
}
colnames(DAT)=c("Year","Group","Value")
DAT=DAT[order( DAT$Year, DAT$Group) , ]

# plot
pal = serie_palette("Lupin", palette_netflyx, 12)
pal = colorRampPalette(pal)(ngroup)
pal=pal[sample(c(1:length(pal)) , size=length(pal) ) ]

ggplot(DAT, aes(x=Year, y=Value, fill=Group )) + 
  geom_area(alpha=1)+
  theme_bw() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = pal)+
  theme(
    text = element_blank(),
    line = element_blank(),
    title = element_blank(),
    legend.position="none",
    panel.border = element_blank(),
    panel.background = element_blank())

Palette: bolt

A classic boxplot 

# Libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(Rseries)

# create a dataset
data <- data.frame(
  name=c( rep("Mount Myōboku",500), rep("Kirigakure",500), rep("Kirigakure",500), rep("Konohagakure",20), rep('Sunagakure', 100)  ),
  value=c( rnorm(500, 10, 5), rnorm(500, 13, 1), rnorm(500, 18, 1), rnorm(20, 25, 4), rnorm(100, 12, 1) )
)

# Plot
pal=serie_palette("bolt", palette_anime, 5)

data %>%
  ggplot( aes(x=name, y=value, fill=name)) +
    geom_boxplot() +
    scale_fill_manual(values=(pal)) +
    theme_classic() +
    theme(
      legend.position="none",
      plot.title = element_text(size=11)
    ) +
    ggtitle("A classic boxplot") +
    xlab("")

Some density charts

    scale_fill_manual(values=(pal)) +
    theme_minimal()

library(RColorBrewer)

# create a dataset
set.seed(345)
ngroup=30
names=paste("G_",seq(1,ngroup),sep="")
DAT=data.frame()

for(i in seq(1:30)){
  data=data.frame( matrix(0, ngroup , 3))
  data[,1]=i
  data[,2]=sample(names, nrow(data))
  data[,3]=prop.table(sample( c(rep(0,113),c(1:ngroup)) ,nrow(data)))
  DAT=rbind(DAT,data)
}
colnames(DAT)=c("Year","Group","Value")
DAT=DAT[order( DAT$Year, DAT$Group) , ]

# plot
pal = serie_palette("bolt", palette_anime, 6)
pal = colorRampPalette(pal)(ngroup)
pal=pal[sample(c(1:length(pal)) , size=length(pal) ) ]

  geom_area(alpha=1)+
  theme_bw() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = pal)+
  theme(
    text = element_blank(),
    line = element_blank(),
    title = element_blank(),
    legend.position="none",
    panel.border = element_blank(),
    panel.background = element_blank())

  data[,1]=i
  data[,2]=sample(names, nrow(data))

# plot

Palette: tokyorev

# Libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(Rseries)

# create a dataset
data <- data.frame(
  name=c( rep("Shibuya",500), rep("Shinjuku",500), rep("Yokohama",500), rep("Umishita Park",20), rep('Musashi Shrine', 100)),
  value=c( rnorm(500, 10, 5), rnorm(500, 13, 1), rnorm(500, 18, 1), rnorm(20, 25, 4), rnorm(100, 12, 1) )
)

# Plot
pal=serie_palette("tokyorev", palette_anime, 5)

data %>%
  ggplot( aes(x=name, y=value, fill=name)) +
    geom_boxplot() +
    scale_fill_manual(values=(pal)) +
    theme_classic() +
    theme(
      legend.position="none",
      plot.title = element_text(size=11)
    ) +
    ggtitle("A classic boxplot") +
    xlab("")

  name=c( rep("Kouka Kingdom",500), rep("Wind Tribe",500), rep("Water Tribe",500), rep("Fire Tribe",20), rep('Kai Empire', 100)),

Palette: cardcaptor

A classic boxplot 

# Libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(Rseries)

# create a dataset
data <- data.frame(
  name=c( rep("Clow Book",500), rep("Clow Cards",500), rep("Clow Cards",500), rep("Sakura Cards",20), rep('Sakura Cards', 100)  ),
  value=c( rnorm(500, 10, 5), rnorm(500, 13, 1), rnorm(500, 18, 1), rnorm(20, 25, 4), rnorm(100, 12, 1) )
)

# Plot
pal=serie_palette("cardcaptor", palette_anime, 5)

data %>%
  ggplot( aes(x=name, y=value, fill=name)) +
    geom_boxplot() +
    scale_fill_manual(values=(pal)) +
    theme_classic() +
    theme(
      legend.position="none",
      plot.title = element_text(size=11)
    ) +
    ggtitle("A classic boxplot") +
    xlab("")

Some data art 

# Libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(RColorBrewer)

# create a dataset
set.seed(345)
ngroup=30
names=paste("G_",seq(1,ngroup),sep="")
DAT=data.frame()

for(i in seq(1:30)){
  data=data.frame( matrix(0, ngroup , 3))
  data[,1]=i
  data[,2]=sample(names, nrow(data))
  data[,3]=prop.table(sample( c(rep(0,113),c(1:ngroup)) ,nrow(data)))
  DAT=rbind(DAT,data)
}
colnames(DAT)=c("Year","Group","Value")
DAT=DAT[order( DAT$Year, DAT$Group) , ]

# plot
pal = serie_palette("cardcaptor", palette_anime, 6)
pal = colorRampPalette(pal)(ngroup)
pal=pal[sample(c(1:length(pal)) , size=length(pal) ) ]

ggplot(DAT, aes(x=Year, y=Value, fill=Group )) + 
  geom_area(alpha=1)+
  theme_bw() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = pal)+
  theme(
    text = element_blank(),
    line = element_blank(),
    title = element_blank(),
    legend.position="none",
    panel.border = element_blank(),
    panel.background = element_blank())
